title: BUG: ValueError is mistakenly raised if a numpy array is assigned to a pd.Series of dtype=object and both have the same length
raw_output:
{'files_to_modify': ['pandas/core/internals/blocks.py', 'pandas/core/internals/managers.py', 'pandas/core/indexing.py', 'pandas/core/series.py', 'pandas/core/dtypes/common.py'], 'reasoning': '1. pandas/core/internals/blocks.py: Contains block assignment and dtype coercion logic—directly involved in raising the ValueError during array assignment to object dtype.
2. pandas/core/internals/managers.py: Manages blocks and handles dispatch of assignment requests; implicated in the stack trace flow.
3. pandas/core/indexing.py: Handles .loc assignment for Series/DataFrame and interfaces with internals; source of user-facing assignment.
4. pandas/core/series.py: Series API may require defensive wrappers or fix misdetection edge cases for assignment to dtype=object.
5. pandas/core/dtypes/common.py: Often involved in type checking and detection logic; modifications here may be needed for correct dtype/object assignment behavior.'}
